patterns: How can I use AB spliting testing
responses:
A/B split testing:
Definition: The process of running simultaneous experiments across multiple pages to determine which one performs the best.

Usege: Marketers use A/B testing to compare two or more elements within a website or piece of content such as copy, email content, landing pages and lead ads.

Activity feed:
Definition: A real-time summary of actions a user takes on a website or web page. It highlights users behavior by tracking cookies and aggregating data into a visual feed.

Usege: Activity feeds give marketers an overview of the interactions and communication users have with a website and may take the form of announcements, messages, login times, etc.

Affiliate marketing:
Definition: A strategy used by content marketers and bloggers to promote products, services or ideas. Affiliate marketers generate passive income by earning commission from advertising the brand of an individual or company.

Usege: This marketing tactic helps companies drive sales and generate revenue.

API (Application Programming Interface):
Definition: A set of protocols and specific standards of communication used for building software applications. It determines how components of a software application should interact. By interpreting data and presenting understandable information.

Usege: API enables the connection and communication between two different programs.

patterns:
AI (Artificial Intelligence):
Definition: An area of computer science that creates, programmes and designs intelligent machines to work, react and “think” like humans.

Usage:Through processing large amounts of data and patterns, AI teaches computers to manage and achieve specific tasks including speech recognition, learning, planning and problem-solving.
